text:
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with chocolate dipped coconut

macaroons that's right there aren't many
recipes especially cookie recipes that

someone can make for the first time ever
and achieve results just as good as

someone that's been making them for
decades but believe it or not that's

exactly how simple these are one of the
main reasons for that is we're gonna be

using a technique that we call in the
business toss everything in a bowl and

mix it which by the way is not even as
complicated as it sounds so with that

let's go ahead and get started by adding
some swing condensed milk to this mixing

bowl and yes if you want you can make
these cookies with white sugar and I've

tried them both ways but I do prefer the
sweetened condensed milk for these and

then to our sweet and sticky we will
also add some almond extract in just a

few drops since that stuff can be
overpowering and then after that we will

also toss in some vanilla extract of the
pure and real variety followed by a nice

pinch of salt and then last but not
least one egg whites and believe it or

not that is it for our base we will
simply take a whisk and give this a mix

until thoroughly combined as judged by
you and once that's been accomplished

it's time for our last and most
important ingredient some coconut and

basically there are two different kinds
you can go with unsweetened which is

what I like to use which tends to be
fairly finely shredded or you can use

the much flakier sweetened coconut but
no matter your choice the next step is

the same as we're gonna take a spatula
and mix this all together and while I do

think using the sweeter flakier coconut
makes for a better looking cookie for me

even though they might have a little
better appearance they're just too sweet

I mean sweetened condensed milk is like
one of the sweetest things ever and then

we're supposed to add sweetened coconut
to that I don't think so but anyway

that's gonna be up to you I mean you are
after all the haystacks Calhoun of your

coconut macaroon and that's a decision
you're gonna have to wrestle with but

either way we're gonna go ahead and mix
that up until we have a sticky sort of

moldable mass right this stuff has to be
moist enough to hold a shape so if you

need to sneak in a little more sweet
condensed milk go ahead and then once

we're happy with our mixture we can go
ahead and start shaping our cookies

which as usual I'd like to do with a
sorbet scoop which i think is less messy

and makes for a more uniform
but instead of transferring those

straight onto our pan we're actually
gonna scoop them in this bowl of plain

shredded coconut and here's where things
get a little hairy and by hairy I mean

Fergie because by rolling these around
in the coconut before we bake them I

think we're gonna get a much nicer much
more interesting and let's say

provocative texture on the surface so
yes this is an optional step but it only

takes a couple minutes and seriously
what else you got to do and then what

we'll do once we've added a little bit
of fur as I like to refer to it let's go

ahead and transfer these onto a Silpat
lined baking sheet and I also like to

make sure those are spaced nice and
evenly I also like to give super obvious

advice all right raise your hand if you
weren't gonna space those evenly and

then what we'll do once those have been
panned up is go ahead and transfer those

into the center of a 350 degree oven for
about 20 minutes or so or until

beautifully golden and hopefully looking
a little something like this

and then what we'll do once these are
out of the oven is let them cool

completely before we serve them which is
not easy but do your best that's all we

ever ask and then what we'll do once
these are cool if we want and trust me

you do will go ahead and dip those
bottoms in some melted chocolate and

we'll let those sit out until our
chocolate hardens up which I almost

managed to do and as you may notice I'm
not really a deep Dipper since I'm not

really into a big bottom on cookies so
as you can see I'm just going up about

an eighth of an inch and that's it once
that chocolate hardens back up these are

ready to enjoy and there really aren't
many better combinations then dark

chocolate and sweet coconut which is
just one of the reasons this cookies

such a crowd-pleaser
and then as far as the texture goes

we're aiming for something kind of moist
and tender and a little bit chewy and by

the way do as I said not as I just did
let that chocolate harden completely

before you try to start eating these
otherwise there will be smears and while

I would be more than happy to just eat
these off the table I'm gonna go ahead

and transfer those onto a freakishly
narrow platter so I can take a few

contractually obligated pictures and
also so I could eat another one oh and

one last thing if you're a fan of a
certain kind of candy bar I don't want

to give the brand name but it has
almonds in it and it brings people joy

what you can do when you form these
before you bake them is stick a roasted

almond or two
the center and then once these are

dipped in chocolate you'll be reliving
that childhood treat or a lesson treat

ah Who am I kidding
adult treat but anyway that's it

chocolate dipped coconut macaroons these
really are amazing any time of the year

but for me especially so during the
summer and not just because I associate

coconut with tropical flavors but also
because they're very fast to make and if

you're bringing them to a cookout or
picnic they are almost indestructible

you can knock over a tray these with a
frisbee pick them up off the ground put

them back on the platter and you're good
to go try doing that with a French

macaron so for those reasons and more I
really do hope you give them a try soon

so head over to food wishes comm for all
the ingredient amounts of more info as
usual and as always enjoy
you
